utterance: <speak>Welcome! You are about to begin the Ted tutor.</speak>
<speak>] With it you will learn a procedure for how to design good science experiments. </speak>
<speak>This procedure is called the control fo variables strategy or vary one thing at time.</speak>

<speak>Ted is a computer tutor. Like a real teacher, ted provides instruction and feedback. Also like real teacher, Ted looks at your answers to see how well you are learning how to design good experiments.</speak>
<speak>If you answer Ted's questions correctly, it will assume that you have learned the material and are ready to advance.</speak>
<speak>If you answer Ted's questions incorrectly, it will assume that you need extra help and more practice.</speak>
<speak>You will move through ted's instruction at your own pace. You may find that sometimes you go backwards and repeat questions</speak>
<speak>This is because Ted as determined, based on you answers, that you need more practice before you can move forward.</speak>
<speak>The only way for Ted to know how much you are learning is through your answers</speak>
<speak>For this reason it's important to make sure you understand what each question is asking and to answer carefully</speak>
